In honor of the summer solstice, here's a one liner to get the current date in R. `Sys.Date()` can be used in R to return the date in YYYY-MM-DD format.

![](images/date1.png)

To get other formats you can wrap `Sys.Date()` in a format function call.

![](images/date2.png)

Here's a listing of some common formats:

<https://statistics.berkeley.edu/computing/faqs/dates-and-times-r>

![](images/date3.png)

Happy Solstice!
